description: A small, translucent slime that disguises itself as a harmless puddle of water. It waits for unsuspecting prey to step into it, then quickly envelops them in its sticky, acidic form.
lair_type: Wet, swampy areas or damp caves

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the Puddle Slime remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal puddle of water.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.description: The Puddle Slime attempts to engulf a creature that steps into it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be engulfed and restrained. The target takes 1d6 acid damage at the start of each of the slime's turns while engulfed. The slime can only engulf one creature at a time.

actions.name: Acidic Touch
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 acid damage.
